or an enforcement procedure initiated against the debtor if it relates to their assets or debts. The bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall rule on the application within ten days from the date of expiry of the period specified for responding to it, by issuing a decision to commence preventive settlement procedures. Within ten days from the date of issuance of the bankruptcy judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence, reject, or not accept the procedures, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall publish and announce the decision, notify concerned parties, disclose it on the Kuwait Stock Exchange <orig>بورصة الكويت للأوراق المالية</orig> if the debtor is listed, and instruct the debtor to disclose it on their website, in the manner deemed appropriate by the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>. The judge may approve the announcement of the decision in a daily newspaper published in a foreign country if a significant portion of the debtor's creditors, assets, or business operations are in that country, or for any other reason deemed appropriate by the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>. In all cases, the decision to commence procedures must be registered within the period specified in the article. The issuance of a decision to commence preventive settlement procedures results in the suspension of claims for the three months following the date of the decision. And, subject to the provisions of this law regarding the application for commencing procedures, the debtor may submit an application for commencing preventive settlement procedures as follows: 7- If a final judgment has previously been issued declaring the debtor's bankruptcy, the application may not be submitted until three years have passed since the conclusion of the bankruptcy. (As an exception to the provisions of clauses (... , ... , 7 ...) of this article, the debtor may submit the application at any time if it is accompanied by evidence of the required majority's prior approval of the preventive settlement proposal for which the application is submitted.

Given the foregoing and guided by the aforementioned legal rules, and since the applicant company, "Bina Furniture and Furnishings Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة بنا للأثاث والمفروشات ذ.م.م</orig>", has submitted an application to commence preventive settlement procedures against all its creditors, specifying the requested procedure and its reason, and has attached the documents and data required by Articles 20 and 59 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> to the extent necessary for the issuance of this decision, and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> has submitted its second and final report No. (140) dated 2025/6/12 to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, concluding with a final opinion recommending the acceptance of the preventive settlement plan according to the previously stated clauses, therefore, the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence preventive settlement procedures. There are debts owed to creditors by the applicant company, as the total bank debts amount to two million eight hundred eighty-seven thousand and forty-one Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig>, the total supplier debts amount to one million eight hundred forty-three thousand and eleven Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig>, the total employee debts amount to one million four hundred thirty thousand three hundred and sixteen Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig>, and there are debts to other parties amounting to one million eight hundred thirty thousand and seven Dinars <orig>دنانير</orig>. Furthermore, the creditors, prior to contacting the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة إفلاس</orig>, agreed from

(Therefore)
### We have decided the following:
First: To commence preventive settlement procedures regarding the application submitted by the debtor (Bina Furniture and Furnishings Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة بنا للأثاث والمفروشات ذ.م.م</orig>), and to suspend all judicial claims and enforcement procedures taken against it for a period of three months from the date of this decision. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall notify the Central Bank <orig>البنك المركزي</orig>, the General Department of Enforcement <orig>الإدارة العامة للتنفيذ</orig>, the applicant company, and the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> of this decision in accordance with Article (55) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and publish and register it in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> within ten days, while instructing the applicant company to disclose this decision on its website and advertise it in two local daily newspapers, one of which is published in English, at its own expense, and to provide proof thereof.

Second: To instruct the debtor (Bina Furniture and Furnishings Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة بنا للأثاث والمفروشات ذ.م.م</orig>) to prepare a preventive settlement proposal including the data required by Article (73) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and to exercise due diligence to persuade creditors to approve the preventive settlement proposal. Within ten days from the date of this decision, the debtor shall coordinate with creditors to form a creditors' committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig> composed of representatives from their debt categories, in accordance with Article (70) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. The debtor shall deposit with the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, within ten days from the expiry of the period specified in the preceding article, a list of debt categories and the formation of the creditors' committee <orig>لجنة الدائنين</orig> in accordance with Article (72) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. A copy of the preventive settlement proposal shall be deposited within a period not exceeding three months from the date of this decision, in accordance with Article (74) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>. Subsequently, the debtor shall endeavor to invite creditors to approve the preventive settlement proposal and complete the procedures stipulated in Articles 76 to 81 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.

# Announcement

On the occasion of the issuance of the decision of the Bankruptcy Judge / Yousef Al-Khaleji <orig>يوسف الخليجي</orig> - dated 2025/6/2
Application No. (2024/117) Declaration of Bankruptcy.
Submitted by / Al-Sultan and Khalaf Trading Company <orig>شركة السلطان وخلف التجارية</orig>
Against / The First Kuwaiti Company for General Trading and Contracting <orig>الشركة الكويتية الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>

Bankruptcy Judge
In the Name of His Highness the Amir of the State of Kuwait
Sheikh Mishal Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah <orig>الشيخ مشعل الأحمد الجابر الصباح</orig>
The High Court

# Decision

On Monday, corresponding to 2025/6/2, at the headquarters of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>
With the membership of Professor / Yousef Al-Khaleji <orig>يوسف الخليجي</orig>, Bankruptcy Judge
And in the presence of Professor / Khalid Abdullah Al-Qaisi <orig>خالد عبد الله القيسي</orig>, Secretary
In Application No.: (2024/117 Declaration of Bankruptcy)
And linked to Lawsuit No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3
Registered under Automated No.: 243742900
After reviewing the documents:
Submitted by: Al-Sultan and Khalaf Trading Company <orig>شركة السلطان وخلف التجارية</orig>
Against: The First Kuwaiti Company for General Trading and Contracting <orig>الشركة الكويتية الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>
Whereas the facts conclude that the applicant filed the application against the respondent for an amount of KWD 38801.212 pursuant to the judgment issued in Lawsuit No. 18911/2019 Commercial Plenary 46, which ordered the respondent to pay the applicant the amount of KWD 38801.212 and obligated it to pay expenses and a Kuwaiti Dinar amount for legal fees. The judgment was upheld in Appeal No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3, and the judgment became final and enforceable. An execution file was opened, and the respondent company was notified, but the respondent company took no action. The applicant then requested an executive attachment of the debtor's assets held by third parties, and it became clear that the respondent company was unable to pay its debts and had ceased paying the amount.
The applicant had based its application for the declaration of bankruptcy against the respondent on Articles (14, 131) of Bankruptcy Law No. 71/2020.
And since the applicant submitted its aforementioned application to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, and the esteemed Advisor, Head of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, referred it to the Bankruptcy Judge to verify the conditions and data. And since the submitted application and its attachments were reviewed, and the applicant's agent attended before the Department and submitted 3 folders of documents, the most important of which included a copy of Judgment No. 18911/2019 Commercial Plenary 46, a certificate of the operative part of Appeal Judgment No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3, a statement of execution procedures against the respondent, and a copy of an extract issued by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> for the respondent company, confirming the signing of executive attachment on the company by more than one creditor, and copies of the respondent company's balance sheets for the years 2019-2020-2021-2022-2023, and a statement of all lawsuits filed against it. The respondent was represented by an agent who submitted a defense memorandum, requesting primarily the non-acceptance of the application and, alternatively, its rejection, and presented a folder of documents that were reviewed and understood. On 2024/12/12, the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> was contacted to provide an opinion on the submitted application. The Committee's opinion was received and concluded that, despite the company being active and having operations, the applicant was unable to obtain its funds despite the existence of judgments and was unable to execute them. It is also inferred that the company uses the partner's current account instead of the company's account for company operations, to prevent creditors from collecting their funds from the company, in addition to the company's failure to collect its funds, whether from accounts receivable or from the partner. These amounts have accumulated for a period, therefore, we recommend appointing a trustee from the list of licensed auditors at the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to inventory the debtor's assets and properties and take all necessary precautionary measures to ensure the debtor's ability to manage its business, provided that the trustee's mission shall be as follows:
1- Verifying accounts receivable and the reason for not collecting those amounts, and whether there is doubt about their collection.
2- Verifying the accuracy of cash reported in the balance sheet and how the company's business is managed.
3- Verifying the partner's current account, the reason for this large amount in the account, how it was formed, and the reason for its non-payment to the company, provided that the trustee submits their report within one month of their appointment or within the period deemed appropriate by the judge, and estimating the trustee's fees for 100 hours at a total amount of KWD 5000, provided that the decision to declare bankruptcy shall be reconsidered after reviewing the trustee's report. The Committee <orig>اللجنة</orig> proposes taking an urgent precautionary measure by imposing restrictions on the managing partner and on Michel Al-Absi <orig>ميشال العبسي</orig> (as a related party to the debtor company) regarding the disposal of their funds, due to the company's use of the partner's current account instead of the company's account for company operations.

Legal Basis:
And whereas Article (13) of the Commercial Law <orig>قانون التجارة</orig> stipulates that: "2- Every company shall also be considered a merchant, even if it engages in non-commercial activities."
And whereas Articles (92, 105) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> stipulate that: "A limited liability company is one in which the number of partners does not exceed fifty partners, and each of them shall not be liable for the company's obligations except to the extent of their share in the capital. The company may adopt a special name derived from its purpose or from the name of one or more partners, provided that the company's name is followed by the phrase (Limited Liability) or the term (LLC.

  "page_summary": "This page from the official gazette 'Kuwait Today' details the legal framework for bankruptcy proceedings under Law No. 71 of 2020, including definitions, conditions for opening proceedings, the role of the bankruptcy judge and trustee, and the specific application of these rules to a company's bankruptcy case."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1744 Seventy-First Year
Sunday 26 Dhu al-Hijjah 1446 AH - 22/6/2025 AD
34
</header>
(L.L.C.)." The directors shall be jointly and severally liable towards the company, partners, and third parties for their violation of the provisions of the law or the company's articles of association, or for errors in management, in accordance with the rules stipulated in the chapter on joint-stock companies in this law."
And whereas Articles (1, 29, 33, 34, 132, 144) of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم 71 لسنة 2020</orig> stipulate that: "In applying the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning indicated opposite each of them... Financial deficit: The debtor's funds are insufficient to pay his debts." "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall rule on the application within ten days from the date of the specified periods for responding to it, by issuing a decision to commence preventive settlement procedures, restructuring, or declaring bankruptcy, and shall specify in his decision a provisional date for the suspension of payments. If the decision to commence procedures is issued after the debtor's death or after his retirement from trade and no date for the suspension of payments is specified, the date of death or retirement from trade shall be considered the provisional date for the suspension of payments." "The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall, within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence, reject, or not accept the procedures, publish and announce the decision and notify the concerned parties." "If the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decides to accept the commencement of bankruptcy, restructuring, or declaration of bankruptcy, and appoints in the same decision the trustee nominated by the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> and whose fees are estimated in accordance with the provisions of this law." "The Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has suspended payments. 2- There is a financial deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not sustainable." "In all cases where the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the bankruptcy commencement application file to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date of the Bankruptcy Judge's <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures. The file shall include a report on the procedures taken regarding the application from its submission until the decision to commence procedures is issued, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision." "Immediately upon the issuance of a decision to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures, the debtor's hand shall be restrained from disposing of and managing his funds and business, and the trustee shall undertake the management of the debtor's funds and business. All dispositions made by the debtor on the day the aforementioned decision is issued shall be considered as having occurred after its issuance, and any disposition issued contrary thereto shall be considered null and void. The trustee may file a lawsuit before the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> to obtain a judgment of its non-enforceability, and may also submit the necessary requests to the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> to take necessary precautionary measures to protect the creditors' rights. The restraint of the debtor's hand does not prevent him from taking the necessary measures to preserve his rights in a way that does not harm the interests of the creditors."
Therefore, and in light of the foregoing, it was established from the documents that the company against which the application was filed had ceased to pay the outstanding debt owed to the applicant, despite the applicant taking enforcement procedures for the judgment issued obliging the company to pay the debt. The debt subject of the application was confirmed by the final judicial judgment issued in Appeal No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3 <orig>الاستئناف رقم 2021/6028 تجاري 3</orig>, and since the report of the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig> was received, it is concluded that the company against which the application was filed has ceased to pay the outstanding debt owed by it since the date of the final judgment issued in favor of the applicant against it in Judgment No. 2021/6028 Commercial 3 <orig>الحكم رقم 2021/6028 تجاري 3</orig> dated 19/12/2021. Therefore, that date shall be the date of suspension of payment of the debt due from the company, despite its maturity, due to its refusal to pay that debt, which results in the acceptance of the application to commence bankruptcy declaration procedures for the company, with the appointment of Mr. Fateh Al-Azmi <orig>فاتح العازمي</orig> as trustee of the bankruptcy, as he is one of the trustees registered with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>.
Therefore, we have decided the following:
First: To commence bankruptcy declaration procedures for Al-Kuwaitiya Al-Oula General Trading and Contracting Company W.L.L. <orig>الشركة الكويتية الأولى للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig> and to set 19/12/2021 as the provisional date for the suspension of payments, and to publish and announce the decision in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and to notify the concerned parties.
Second: To appoint Mr. Fateh Al-Azmi <orig>فاتح العازمي</orig> as trustee of the bankruptcy, and his fees are estimated at a total amount of five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> from the date of issuance of this decision until the closure of the bankruptcy. He shall inventory the assets and properties of the debtor company, take all necessary precautionary measures, and prepare a list of debts and a liquidation and distribution plan.
Secretary
Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>
In accordance with Article (8) of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, decisions issued by the Bankruptcy Judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall be executive instruments according to this law, and the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall affix the enforcement formula to them, and they shall be enforceable immediately upon their issuance without notification.
<page_end>34</page_end>

# Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>
## Ministerial Decision No. (122) of 2025
### Regarding the Issuance of a Regulatory Bylaw for Charitable Endowments (Mabarrat)
The Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs,
- Having reviewed Law No. 1959 regarding the regulation of licensing the collection of funds for public purposes.
- And Law No. (24) of 1962 concerning clubs and public benefit associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig>, its amendments, and the decisions implementing it.
- And Law No. (14) of 1994 amending some provisions of Law No. (24) of 1962.
- And Decree No. (50) of 2017 concerning the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- And Cabinet Decision No. 74 of 1999 concerning the system of charitable endowments (Mabarrat).
- And Ministerial Decision No. 48 of 1999 regarding the issuance of the Model Articles of Association for Charitable Endowments (Mabarrat).
- And Ministerial Decision No. (104) of 2002 regarding the establishment of the Department of Charitable Associations and Endowments (Mabarrat).
- And Ministerial Decision No. (49/A) of 2015 regarding the issuance of a regulatory bylaw for Charitable Endowments (Mabarrat).
- And Ministerial Decision No. (128/A) of 2016 issuing the bylaw regulating the collection of donations and its amendments.
- And based on the exigencies of public interest.
- And after the presentation by the Undersecretary of the Ministry.
"Has Decided"
### Article One
Charitable endowments (Mabarrat) shall be subject, in terms of their establishment, organization, management, and supervision, to the provisions of the bylaw attached to this Decision.
### Article Two
Ministerial Decision No. (49/A) of 2015 regarding the issuance of a regulatory bylaw for Charitable Endowments (Mabarrat) shall be repealed.
### Article Three
This Decision and its attached bylaw shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall come into force from the date of its publication. Any provision conflicting with its terms shall be repealed.
Minister of Social Affairs and Family and Childhood Affairs
Dr. Amthal Hadi Al-Huwaila <orig>د. أمثال هادي الهويلة</orig>

# Regulatory Bylaw for Charitable Endowments (Mabarrat)
## Chapter One
### Definitions and General Provisions
### Article (1)
For the purpose of applying the provisions of this bylaw, the following terms shall have the meanings assigned to each of them:
- The Minister: The Minister of Social Affairs <orig>وزير الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- The Ministry: The Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- The Department: The Department of Charitable Associations and Endowments (Mabarrat) <orig>إدارة الجمعيات الخيرية والمبرات</orig>.
- The Law: Law No. 24 of 1962 concerning clubs and public benefit associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and its amendments.
- The Applicant: Any natural or legal person who has submitted an application for the declaration of a charitable endowment (Mabarra).
- The Mabarra: The charitable endowment declared in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 24 of 1962 concerning clubs and public benefit associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and its amendments.
### Article (2)
The founders and members of the Mabarra's board of directors shall adhere to the provisions of Law No. 24 of 1962 and its amendments concerning clubs and public benefit associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and the decisions implementing it, and Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning private sector work <orig>العمل الأهلي</orig>, and shall be guided by the Model Articles of Association for Charitable Endowments (Mabarrat) issued by Ministerial Decision No. 48 of 1999.
### Article (3)
The charitable endowment (Mabarra) subject to the provisions of this bylaw shall comply with all regulatory instructions and security and safety procedures issued by the Ministry in coordination with the relevant authorities.
### Article (4)
- The applicant is prohibited from engaging in any charitable or social activity except after the declaration of the Mabarra in accordance with the established system and conditions in this regard.
- The applicant may not contract or conclude any transaction in the name of the Mabarra before its declaration by the Ministry.
- The location of the Mabarra may not be moved, its specifications modified, or a branch established for it without obtaining prior written approval from the Ministry.
- The Mabarra shall refrain from soliciting any donations from the public or inviting such in any form, except after obtaining the Ministry's approval.

## Chapter Two
### Conditions and Procedures for Declaration
### Article (5)
The following conditions are required for the declaration of a charitable endowment (Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig>):-
1- The number of founders shall not be less than ten persons.
2- The age of the founders shall not be less than 21 calendar years at the time of submitting the declaration application.
3- The founder must be of Kuwaiti nationality, of good reputation and conduct, and must not have been previously convicted of a felony or misdemeanor involving moral turpitude or breach of trust.
4- The age of candidates for membership in the Mabarra's <orig>مبرة</orig> Board of Directors shall not be less than 30 calendar years at the time of selecting the administration.
5- Obtaining security approval for the founders and ensuring there is no impediment to the declaration of the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig>.
6- Obtaining approvals from official state authorities for the necessary licenses for the declaration of the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> (Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء</orig>, Real Estate Registration Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري</orig>).
7- Submission by the founders or their representatives of a bank certificate confirming the deposit of K.D. 10,000 (ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) in the name of the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> with one of the local banks.

### Article (6)
The procedures for declaring a Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> include the following:-
1- An application for the declaration of the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> shall be submitted by the founders or their representatives, and the application shall include a disclosure of the founders' desire to declare the charitable Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> in accordance with the provisions of the law.
2- The following documents shall be attached to the application:-
- 2 copies of the Articles of Association of the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> to be declared, in conformity with the Model Articles of Association for Charitable Mabarrat <orig>مبرات</orig>.
- Minutes of the founders' meeting including the selection of the members of the Mabarra's <orig>مبرة</orig> Board of Directors.
- A letter from the founders authorizing one of them to represent the founders in the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> declaration procedures.
- A copy of the civil IDs of the founders, provided they are valid.
3- Upon completion of the application requirements and procedures mentioned, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall contact the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> to obtain its approval for the founders.
4- The declaration application shall be presented to the competent Declaration Committee <orig>اللجنة المختصة بالإشهار</orig> in the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> to obtain its preliminary approval for the declaration.
5- The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall contact the competent state authorities (Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, Fire Force <orig>قوة الإطفاء</orig>, Real Estate Registration Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>) to obtain the necessary licenses for the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig>, as well as the Ministry of Justice's <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> authentication of its Articles of Association.
6- The competent department in the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall submit a memorandum to His Excellency the Minister <orig>معالي الوزير</orig> regarding the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> declaration application and the procedures undertaken, accompanied by a draft ministerial decision for its declaration.
7- The declaration decision and a summary of the Articles of Association shall be published in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>).

### Article (7)
Upon its declaration, the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> shall acquire legal personality and shall be entitled to carry out all activities that achieve its objectives.

### Article (8)
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> has the right to refuse the registration of the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> within one month from the date of submitting a complete application, stating the reasons for refusal. It may also introduce any amendments it deems appropriate to the Mabarra's <orig>مبرة</orig> Articles of Association. The applicant may appeal the refusal decision or the amendment of the Articles of Association to the Minister <orig>الوزير</orig> within one month from the date of notification of the refusal and amendment.

### Article (9)
Upon its declaration, the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> shall be committed to conducting its activities at the Mabarra's <orig>مبرة</orig> approved headquarters, as endorsed by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> after obtaining the approval of the relevant authorities.

### Article (10)
The Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> shall place an identification sign at its approved headquarters, including the name of the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> and the number of the declaration decision issued by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.

## Chapter Three
### Management of Charitable Endowments (Mabarrat <orig>مبرات</orig>)
### Article (11)
The Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> shall be managed by a Board of Directors for a period of two years, consisting of five members from among the Mabarra's <orig>مبرة</orig> members, and not exceeding nine members who have reached thirty calendar years of age, provided that they hold a university degree or a diploma of no less than two years after general secondary education.

### Article (12)
The Board shall manage the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig> in accordance with the competencies stipulated in the Model Articles of Association for Charitable Mabarrat <orig>مبرات</orig> and the Mabarra's <orig>مبرة</orig> Articles of Association.

### Article (13)
The Board of Directors shall annually submit to the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> a financial report certified by the external auditor appointed by the Mabarra <orig>مبرة</orig>, and an administrative report on the Mabarra's <orig>مبرة</orig> activities and achievements within the deadlines specified according to the Articles of Association.
<page_end>36</page_end>

Article (14)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be committed to establishing regulations governing the work within the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig>, and specifically the following:
- Financial regulations.
- Administrative regulations.

Article (15)
The Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> shall be committed to opening nominations for membership in the Endowment's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة المبرة</orig> for a period of fifteen days, at least one month before the end of the current Board of Directors' term. This shall be announced on the notice board at the Endowment's headquarters and registered letters with acknowledgment of receipt shall be sent to the members.

Article (16)
The members of the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot, under the supervision of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.

Article (17)
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall approve a list of the names of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members selected by the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> in accordance with the preceding procedures.

Chapter Four
Supervision and Oversight

Article (18)
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall supervise the registered Endowments <orig>المبرات المشهرة</orig> in accordance with the provisions of the law, through the employees of the competent department <orig>الإدارة المختصة</orig>, who shall have the right to inspect the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> at any time without prior notice. For this purpose, they shall have the right to enter the Endowment's headquarters and review the records, data, and information related to the Endowment's work.

Article (19)
In the event that the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> is proven to have committed any violations of the provisions of the law and the decisions issued in implementation thereof, the employees of the competent department <orig>الإدارة المختصة</orig> shall issue a violation report against the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> using the designated form.

Chapter Five
Penalties

Article (20)
In addition to the penalties stipulated by law or any other law, in the event of the Endowment's <orig>المبرة</orig> violation of the provisions of the law and the decisions issued in implementation thereof, the following procedures shall be applied:
- Notifying the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> of the violation.
- If the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> fails to rectify the violation within one week of notification, all accounts of the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> shall be suspended and shall not be reopened until the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> has rectified the violation.

Article (21)
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall have the right to suspend the registration of the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> in the following cases:
- The Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> committing serious violations, or continuing to commit violations despite being notified by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>, or repeatedly committing violations.
- The Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> failing to submit the balance sheet and administrative report for two consecutive years.
- Concealing any financial information or data requested by the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>, or manipulating data, or providing false information with malicious intent to mislead the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> and prevent it from performing its oversight role.

Article (22)
The Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> may be dissolved by a decision of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>, based on a proposal from the Minister of Social Affairs <orig>وزير الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>, in one of the following cases:
- If its membership decreases to less than the number stipulated in Article Four of this Law.
- If it becomes unable to meet its financial obligations.
- If it violates the provisions of this Law or the basic statute of the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig>, or performs actions that deviate from its objectives.
- If it fails to undertake any effective activity to achieve its purposes.
- If reasons of public interest or public security necessitate it.

Article (23)
By a decision of the Minister of Social Affairs <orig>وزير الشئون الاجتماعية</orig>, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة المبرة</orig> of the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig> may be dissolved, and a temporary board of directors or manager may be appointed for a specified, renewable period, to assume the powers vested in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, in the following circumstances:
1- Violation of the provisions of this Law or the basic statute of the Association <orig>الجمعية</orig>.
2- If the number of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members becomes insufficient for a valid quorum.
3- If the interest of the members or the social objectives of the community necessitate it.

Article (24)
In the event of the dissolution of the Endowment <orig>المبرة</orig>, the Minister <orig>الوزير</orig> shall issue a decision to form a committee to liquidate its assets, specifying the method of liquidation, the duration of liquidation, and the fees of the liquidators. This period may be renewed for more than one term until the liquidation process is completed.

### Article (25)
The funds of the Directorate <orig>المديرة</orig>, after its liquidation, shall devolve to the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> to determine the entity to which these funds shall devolve.

### Article (26)
In the event of a decision to dissolve the Directorate <orig>المديرة</orig>, its Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة المديرة</orig> must hand over its movable and immovable assets and collect all documents and records to the Liquidation Committee <orig>لجنة التصفية</orig>.

# Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>
## Resolution No. (104) of 2025
### Regarding
Renewal of Securities Activities License for Al-Masar Leasing and Investment Company <orig>شركة المسار للإجارة والاستثمار</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- And the securities activities license certificate for Al-Masar Leasing and Investment Company <orig>شركة المسار للإجارة والاستثمار</orig> No. (AP/2019/0005) issued on 2022/08/26;
- And the request from Al-Masar Leasing and Investment Company <orig>شركة المسار للإجارة والاستثمار</orig> to renew its securities activities license with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector <orig>قطاع الإشراف</orig>, issued on 2025/01/12.

It has been decided as follows:
### Article One
Renewal of the securities activity license for Al-Masar Leasing and Investment Company <orig>شركة المسار للإجارة والاستثمار</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to practice the activity of a collective investment scheme manager. This is for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 2025/08/26.

### Article Two
The competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Head of the Supervision Sector <orig>رئيس قطاع الإشراف</orig>
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>

# Resolution No. (106) of 2025
## Regarding a Private Marketing License for a Collective Investment Scheme Established Outside the State of Kuwait, Granted to KAMCO Investment Company for Marketing Units of Project Odyssey Leasing Company Limited

**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The Articles of Association and Memorandum of Incorporation of KAMCO Investment Company <orig>شركة كامكو للاستثمار</orig>;
- The request from KAMCO Investment Company <orig>شركة كامكو للاستثمار</orig> to undertake the private marketing of units of Project Odyssey Leasing Company Limited <orig>شركة بروجيكت أوديسي ليسنغ المحدودة</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Has resolved the following:**

### Article One:
KAMCO Investment Company <orig>شركة كامكو للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 85,000,000 units (eighty-five million units only) of Project Odyssey Leasing Company Limited <orig>شركة بروجيكت أوديسي ليسنغ المحدودة</orig> (Project Odessey Leasing Company Limited) within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, established in Jersey Island. The offer price shall be 1 US Dollar (one US Dollar only) per unit, in addition to a subscription commission of 1% of the invested amount, payable once upon subscription.

### Article Two:
The units to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered to professional clients only, as per the text contained in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, and their amendments. The entity receiving subscription requests shall be:
- KAMCO Investment Company <orig>شركة كامكو للاستثمار</orig>.

### Article Three:
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

### Article Four:
The marketing license duration is one year, renewable annually, commencing from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

**Has resolved the following:**

Renewal of the securities activities license for Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig> with the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to practice the activity of an underwriting agent. This is for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 05/09/2025.

### Article Two:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

## Article Two

The General Standardization Committee <orig>اللجنة العامة للتوحيد القياسي</orig> is responsible for approving the general policy followed by the Department, planning its programs, and monitoring its activities. It may take any decisions and measures it deems necessary to achieve the Department's objectives and protect its goals. Specifically, it shall:
1. Approve and amend Kuwaiti Standard Specifications <orig>المواصفات القياسية الكويتية</orig> whenever necessary.
2. Form technical committees, working groups, and other necessary bodies to accomplish the Department's work.
3. Monitor the activities of committees and approve their decisions.
4. Approve licenses for the Department's insignia.
5. Establish the internal regulations and bylaws necessary for the workflow of the Department.
6. Study reports submitted on the progress of work in the Department.
7. Propose sending missions, study leaves, scientific assignments, and others.
8. Determine the fees charged by the Department for the services it provides.
9. Estimate the remuneration for consultants, experts, and committee members whom the Department utilizes.

## Article Three

The General Committee shall meet upon the invitation of its Chairman or at the request of at least one-third of its members. For its meeting to be valid, at least half of its members must be present, including the Chairman or his deputy.
The General Committee may invite whomever it deems necessary to attend its sessions, without them having a counted vote in the deliberations.
Its decisions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the number of members present, and in case of a tie, the side of the Chairman shall prevail.

## Article Four

The General Committee may delegate some of its competencies to a committee from among its members or to one of its members. It may also delegate or assign one of its members or one of the Department's employees to carry out a specific task.

## Article Five

The technical committees shall undertake the tasks entrusted to them by the General Committee. The Department may seek assistance from experts, specialists, and technicians from state ministries, their departments, and other entities.

## Article Six

All committee members shall be appointed for a period of three years by a decision of the Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Director of the Standards and Metrology Department <orig>مدير إدارة المواصفات والمقاييس</orig> shall assume the secretariat of the committee.

## Article Seven

All ministerial decisions that conflict with the provisions of this decision shall be repealed.

## Article Eight

This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its publication. The competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> shall implement its provisions.

It was decided
### Article One
The following amendments to Warba Bank's <orig>بنك وربة</orig> data shall be recorded in the Islamic Banks Register at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>:
1- Increase of the Bank's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 218,360,000 to KWD 231,461,600. This increase represents 6% bonus shares.
This is in accordance with the Bank's final financial statements for the fiscal year ended 2024/12/31.
2- Increase of the Bank's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from KWD 231,461,600 to KWD 449,821,600. This increase represents 100% through the issuance of priority rights to the Bank's shareholders.
This is in accordance with the Bank's final financial statements for the fiscal year ended 2024/12/31.
3- Increase of the legal reserve from KWD 89,246,000 to KWD 91,599,700 (including a share premium of KWD 80,375,000).
This is in accordance with the Bank's final financial statements for the fiscal year ended 2024/12/31.
4- Increase of the legal reserve from KWD 91,599,700 to KWD 309,959,700 (including a share premium of KWD 298,735,000). This increase represents the share premium resulting from the capital increase through the issuance of priority rights to the Bank's shareholders.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Correction
A typographical error occurred in Issue (1743) published on (15/6/2025) when publishing the announcement related to the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> as shown below:
and pertaining to lawsuit 159/2023 Sales/3.
Therefore, we are re-publishing after correcting the error.

## Announcement of the Public Auction Sale of a Company Share
The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction sale of one share in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>, owned by Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبدالله</orig>, as described below. The auction will take place on Thursday, 10/7/2025, in Hall 5, 8th Floor, New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig>, at 9:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 159/2023 Sales/3.
Filed by: Kuwait Pearl Real Estate Company K.S.C.C. (Closed) <orig>شركة لؤلؤة الكويت العقارية ش م ك مقفله</orig>.
Against: Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبدالله</orig>.
1- Director of the Execution Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig>, in his capacity.
2- Mahdi Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>مهدي محمود حاجي حيدر عبدالله</orig>.
3- Mansour Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>منصور محمود حاجي حيدر عبدالله</orig>.
4- Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>محمود حاجي حيدر عبدالله</orig>.
5- Zaid Jassim Zaid Al-Khabbaz <orig>زيد جاسم زيد الخباز</orig>, in his capacity as judicial custodian for Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>.
Firstly: Description of the Share Offered for Sale in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>
Sale of the defendant's share / Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حجي حيدر عبدالله</orig> in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات</orig>, which is only one share, by public auction, with a base price of / K.D. 65,647.800 (Sixty-five thousand six hundred forty-seven Kuwaiti Dinars and 800 Fils).
Subject: Report on the Valuation of Shares Owned by Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبدالله</orig> in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig>
With reference to the General Court's <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> assignment, by virtue of the judgment issued in lawsuit No. 159/2023 Sales/3 dated November 23, 2023, regarding the appointment of an auditor (expert) accredited by the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> to prepare a study report determining the fair value of the shares owned by Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبدالله</orig> in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig>, amounting to one share as of December 31, 2023.
After reviewing the lawsuit documents and the submitted documents by Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company (W.L.L.) <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات (ذ.م.م)</orig>, including the Limited Liability Company Amendment Contract dated July 9, 2019, it is clear that Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah's <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> share in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading and Contracting Company W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig> consists of one share, representing 1% of the company's total shares.
In light of the information and data obtained from the management, and due to the assumed limitations of the received information, the information may be incomplete. Therefore, the management of the company under valuation has undertaken to provide this data and information as correct without any confirmation.

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>
## Announcement
The owners of Dana Design General Trading Company <orig>شركة دانه ديزاين للتجارة العامة</orig> have submitted a request. ## Company Under Liquidation
A request has been submitted to the Department of Partnerships <orig>إدارة شركات الأشخاص</orig> at the Ministry to carry out / dissolve and liquidate the company. Legal Entity: Limited Liability Company.
Anyone with an objection is requested to submit it to the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> within thirty days from the date of publication of this announcement, in accordance with the usual procedures for filing a lawsuit. The submission of an objection will result in the continued obligation of the joint partners, in the case of a general partnership or a simple limited partnership, only in facing this creditor, until a final judgment is rendered on their objection.

Accordingly, the net amount allocated to Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> becomes KWD 1,066,089.63 (One Million, Sixty-Six Thousand, Eighty-Nine Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and Sixty-Three Fils <orig>فلس</orig>) after deducting the outstanding debit balance due from him as of December 31, 2023.
In accordance with the court decision regarding the appointment of the expert dated November 23, 2023, which was for the purpose of estimating the value of only one share, we have valued the company and determined the value of one share for Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig>. The matter is left to the Court Panel <orig>هيئة المحكمة</orig> to consider other submitted documents and judgments.
This valuation is subject to the assumptions and restrictive conditions presented in the attached sections of this report, and the valuation summary should be read in conjunction with the detailed valuation report presented in the following pages.

## 2. Sources of Information:
Our work relied on the following sources of information received from the company: unaudited administrative financial statements for the company's operations for the years 2021, 2022, 2023 (Statement of Financial Position and Income Statement only).
*   Statement of debit and credit balances.
*   Statement of investment balances.
*   Statement of related party balances.
*   Memorandum of Association of Mahmoud Haidar and Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> and its amendments.
*   List of lawsuits by or against the company.
*   Commercial Register extract dated August 2023.
It is worth noting that we have primarily relied on the unaudited administrative financial statements for the company's operations during the period (2021-2023) (Statement of Financial Position and Income Statement only), which were provided by the company's management under its full responsibility. Any breach or deficiency in these data and information could negatively or positively affect the fair value of the company. The company's management bears full responsibility for the accuracy, completeness, and correctness of these data and information.
In our work, we cannot express an opinion on the adequacy of provisions for doubtful debts, amounts due from and to sister companies, amounts due from related parties, amounts due from and to customers, lawsuits, or any other potential liabilities of the company, or the recognition of any impairment in the fair value of the company's long-term or current assets.

## 3. Scope Limitations of the Valuation

W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31, 2023.
Whereas the company has provided the expert with legal information and financial data regarding 100 shares, each valued at KWD 600, distributed among the partners as follows:

The purposes for which the company was established are general trading and contracting, buying and selling shares and bonds solely for the company's account, and buying and selling land and real estate solely for the company's account.

## 1.6. Value Standard
The value standard used is Fair Market Value, which is defined as "the price at which property would change hands between a willing buyer and a willing seller, neither being under any compulsion to buy or to sell, and both having reasonable knowledge of relevant facts."

## 1.7. Professional Standards
The valuation and the similar report were prepared in accordance with the professional standards of the National Association of Certified Valuation Analysts <orig>الجمعية الوطنية لمحللي التقييم المعتمدين</orig>, where appropriate procedures were followed (in our professional opinion) for the requirements of the scope of work, given the time available to complete the valuation report preparation task.

## 1.8. Valuation Date
The valuation was conducted as of December 31, 2023.

## 1.9. Value Conclusion
In our opinion, based on our analysis of the information presented in this report and the underlying assumptions, and based on the Net Asset Value method, the net asset value of Mahmoud Haidar and Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> as of December 31, 2023, is concluded to be KWD 7,294,211 (Seven Million, Two Hundred Ninety-Four Thousand, Two Hundred Eleven Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
Consequently, the value of one share is estimated at KWD 72,942.11 (Seventy-Two Thousand, Nine Hundred Forty-Two Dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and Eleven Kuwaiti Fils <orig>فلس كويتي</orig>) = 7,294,211 ÷ 100 = KWD 72,942.11.
After reviewing the case documents and the documents submitted by Mahmoud Haidar and Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig>, including the amendment contract for a limited liability company dated July 9, 2019, it is clear to us that Mr. Maitham Mahmoud Haji Haidar Abdullah's <orig>ميثم محمود حاجي حيدر عبد الله</orig> share in Mahmoud Haidar and Sons General Trading and Contracting Co. W.L.L. <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م.</orig> consists of one share, representing 1% of the company's total shares.

## 5.1 Valuation Approaches / Methods
There are three traditional valuation approaches: the income approach, the market approach, and the cost or asset approach. Professionals differ on the classification or definition of valuation methods within these three types. However, it is generally agreed that all valuation methods can be described as either one of these approaches or a combination of two or more of them.

### 5.1.5 Market Approach
- The market approach is a method of determining the value indicator of a business, an ownership interest in a business, a security, or an intangible asset using one or more methods that compare the subject with similar businesses, ownership interests, securities, or intangible assets that have been generally sold. This can be accomplished by comparing with publicly traded companies or by analyzing actual transactions of similar businesses sold. It may also include an analysis of prior transactions in the company's shares (if any).
### 5.3.1 Asset Approach
- The asset approach is based on the value of net assets less liabilities. As commonly used, this approach starts with the balance sheet book values as close as possible to the valuation date, and assets and liabilities, including unrecorded ones, are re-listed at fair value.
- Different valuation methods, including one or more of the three categories of valuation approaches, can be used in any valuation study. All applicable methods must be considered, and the most reliable method(s) for valuing the subject properties that are suitable for the valuation study should be selected.
### 5.2 Selected Methodology
- The following valuation approach that we adopted to determine the fair value of equity in the company is the Asset Approach (Net Asset Value method), given that Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading & Contracting LLC <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig> has no current operating elements and its value lies in its net current assets and investments.

## 6. Conclusion
- Based on our analysis of the information presented in this report, the underlying assumptions, and the Net Asset Value method, it was concluded that the net asset value as of December 31, 2023, and therefore the fair value of equity in Mahmoud Haidar & Sons General Trading & Contracting LLC <orig>شركة محمود حيدر وأولاده للتجارة العامة والمقاولات ذ.م.م</orig> as of December 31, 2023, is KWD 8,581,424 (eight million, five hundred eighty-one thousand, four hundred twenty-four Kuwaiti Dinars). Taking into account a 15% discount factor, the value becomes KWD 7,294,211 (seven million, two hundred ninety-four thousand, two hundred eleven Kuwaiti Dinars).
- Consequently, the value of one share is estimated at KWD 72,942.11 (seventy-two thousand, nine hundred forty-two Dinars and eleven Fils Kuwaiti) – 7,294,211 ÷ 100 = KWD 72,942.11.

Firstly: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated in the descriptions. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees immediately upon the conclusion of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit in the auction. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by a full deposit of its value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the sale price of the shares.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for amending the company's articles of association, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to KWD 200 <orig>200 د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

Eighthly: The company has the right to object to the joining of the bidder who submitted the best offer within three days from the date the court approves their offer.
Ninthly: The company and any of the partners may - even before the issuance of the judgment awarding the auction - settle the debt of the debtor partner to the attaching creditor.
Tenthly: The company may - even before the issuance of the judgment awarding the auction - recover a portion of the seized shares to the extent sufficient to satisfy the creditor's debt.

Decree No. (12) of 2024
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Decree No. (15) of 1979
Concerning the Civil Service System
Having reviewed the Constitution,
And Decree-Law No. (15) of 1979 concerning the Civil Service System and its amendments,
And Decree No. (12) of 2024 amending some provisions of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979,
And based on the submission of the Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

<table>
| Article | Original Text | Amended Text |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions. | Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions in accordance with the provisions of this Decree. |
| 2 | The executive regulations shall specify the conditions for appointment. | The executive regulations shall specify the conditions and controls for appointment. |
</table>

Article (1)
The text of Article (1) of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979 shall be replaced with the following text:
"Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions in accordance with the provisions of this Decree."
Article (2)
The text of Article (2) of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979 shall be replaced with the following text:
"The executive regulations shall specify the conditions and controls for appointment."
Article (3)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 10 Sha'ban 1445 AH <orig>10 شعبان 1445 هـ</orig>
Corresponding to: 20 February 2024 AD <orig>20 فبراير 2024 م</orig>

# Ministry of Islamic Affairs / Wizarat Al-Shu'un Al-Islamiyah <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig>

## Announcement

Request for Quotations No. 2-2025/2026 regarding the lease of a building in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> area

The Ministry of Islamic Affairs / Wizarat Al-Shu'un Al-Islamiyah <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig> announces an invitation to building owners to submit price quotations for leasing a building in the South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> area, in accordance with the following conditions:
1.  The building must have at least two and a half floors.
2.  The building must be located within the South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig> areas (Hattin <orig>حطين</orig> – Al-Zahra <orig>الزهراء</orig> – Al-Salam <orig>السلام</orig> – Al-Siddiq <orig>الصديق</orig>).
3.  It must contain parking spaces for teaching and administrative staff and students.
4.  A place for a security guard must be available.
5.  All services such as electricity, water, and telephone must be available, and the electrical and telephone networks must be well-prepared.
*   Those wishing to lease their buildings, who meet the aforementioned conditions and specifications, are requested to visit the Ministry of Islamic Affairs / Wizarat Al-Shu'un Al-Islamiyah <orig>وزارة الشؤون الإسلامية</orig> in (Al-Mirqab <orig>المرقاب</orig> area, opposite the Fourth Ring Road – Financial Affairs Department, Sixth Floor – Tenders Section) to fill out the relevant price quotation forms, starting from 22/06/2025 AD until the end of working hours on 07/06/2025 AD, bringing with them copies of:
1.  The property deed.
2.  The owner's Civil ID.
3.  Neighbors' approval.

**Tamdeen Entertainment Company <orig>شركة التمدين الترفيهية</orig>**
**(Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company)**
**Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting**

The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Tamdeen Entertainment Company <orig>شركة التمدين الترفيهية</orig> was held on Sunday, June 15, 2025, at 10:30 AM at the company's headquarters located in Khaitan Complex <orig>مجمع خيطان</orig>.

The meeting was chaired by Mr. Ahmed Al-Osaimi <orig>أحمد العصيمي</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors and CEO. Also present at the meeting were Mr. Ali Bader Abdullah Al-Wazzan <orig>علي بدر عبد الله الوزان</orig>, the auditor, and shareholders owning 85,000,000 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 100% of the company's total shares.

After the quorum was announced, Mr. Ahmed Al-Osaimi <orig>أحمد العصيمي</orig> discussed the agenda items as follows:
1- Amendment of Article (5) of the Articles of Incorporation and Article (4) of the Articles of Association.
**Text Before Amendment:**
1- Management, operation, and equipping of restaurants, cafes, ready meals, parks, recreational and tourist facilities, and amusement games for adults and children, in accordance with applicable regulations, as well as party halls, and importing necessary equipment, games, and materials for this purpose.
2- Ownership of internal real estate necessary to achieve the company's objectives.
3- Management and operation of health clubs.
4- Establishment of nurseries.
5- Utilizing the company's available financial surpluses by investing them in financial and real estate portfolios managed by specialized companies.
6- Importing chemical materials - 461033. The company may directly carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either as a principal or by agency. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities engaged in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.

Minutes of the Second Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on 12/06/2025
The Extraordinary General Assembly of Kuwait International Takaful Insurance Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية العالمية للتأمين التكافلي</orig> convened at the company's headquarters located on Arabian Gulf Street, Ahmed Tower, at 11:00 AM on Thursday, 12/06/2025, with a quorum of 100%. The meeting of the General Assembly was chaired by the Chairman of the Company's Board of Directors, with the attendance of:
- 1 Mr. Ghanem Miz'al Fahad Al-Shammari <orig>غانم مزعل فهد الشمري</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors
- 2 Mr. Abdulaziz Saud Faraj Al-Mutairi <orig>عبد العزيز سعود فرج المطيري</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors
- 3 Ms. Sahar Majed Faour <orig>سحر ماجد فاعور</orig>, Secretary
- 4 Mr. Nasser Saud Al-Manea <orig>ناصر سعود المنيع</orig>, Al-Khaleejia for Securities Custody <orig>الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>
The General Assembly ratified the following items:
- 1 Amendment of the text of Article No. (14) of the Articles of Association:
Text before amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) five members, from whom the entity or entities authorized to appoint representatives to the Board of Directors shall appoint members in proportion to their shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot.
Text after amendment:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) five members, provided that (2) two of them are independent members, and their number shall not exceed half of the Board of Directors members. The entity or entities authorized to appoint representatives to the Board of Directors shall appoint members in proportion to their shareholding in the company, and the General Assembly shall elect the remaining members by secret ballot.
- 2 Increase of the authorized and paid-up capital from KWD 5,000,000 (Five Million Kuwaiti Dinars only) to KWD 6,250,000 (Six Million Two Hundred and Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only), by an amount of KWD 1,250,000 (One Million Two Hundred and Fifty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars only).

The authorized capital of the company is set at (5 million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) only (five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> and no more).

In all cases where the full amount of new shares is not subscribed for, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders. The unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed cancelled by operation of law.

### Article (10)
The company may increase its capital through public subscription, as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

### Article (11)
The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by the following two limitations:
1- Requiring a right of priority for the company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2- Requiring the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for the share purchaser.
Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> are exempted from these two limitations.
(This provision does not apply to companies listed on the stock exchange).

### Article (12)
(Mandatory text if the first limitation of Article 11 of these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> is adopted)
Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the company of the terms of sale. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have elapsed from the date of notification without any of the shareholders submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder comes forward to purchase the shares, this must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.

### Article (13)
(Mandatory text if the second limitation of Article 11 of these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> is adopted)
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the company's purchase of its own shares, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, in the event of its refusal of the purchaser's person, must purchase the shares on behalf of the company within ten days from the date the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is notified of the request for approval. The purchase in this case shall be at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.

### Article (14)
**Subscription**
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the company with shares numbering (12,500,000) twelve million five hundred thousand shares, with a nominal value of (K.D. 1,250,000) (one million two hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), distributed among them, each according to their subscription ratio specified in the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>. An amount of (K.D. 1,250,000) of the nominal value of the shares they subscribed for has been paid to (Warba Bank <orig>بنك وربة</orig>) as per the bank's certificate dated 07/05/2025 AD.
The remaining part of the share value shall be paid within a maximum period of five years from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and on the dates determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. If a shareholder delays in paying the installment due on their shares on time, the company must, after fifteen days from the date of their warning, offer their shares for sale to the remaining shareholders. The company shall recover from the sale price of the shares, with priority over all creditors of the shareholder, the value of the unpaid installments, interest, and any expenses incurred by the company. The remainder shall be returned to the shareholder. If the sale price of the shares is insufficient, the company shall claim the remainder from the shareholder's private funds.

### Article (15)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholder's acceptance of the Articles of Incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.

### Article (16)
Every share grants its owner the right to an equal, non-discriminatory share in the ownership of the company's assets and in the distributed profits.

### Article (17)
The company shall maintain a special register <orig>سجل خاص</orig> with the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each of them, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes to the registered data shall be endorsed in the shareholders' register <orig>سجل المساهمين</orig> according to the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

### Article (18)
**Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>**
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must call for the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> for subscription, and before the meeting of the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, they must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of shares subscribed for, the payment of due installments by subscribers, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed for by each of them, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must call for the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription. If the period expires without the assembly being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the said period, call for the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

### Article (20)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1- Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2- Advertisement, which must be published twice, with the second advertisement published at least seven days after the date of the first advertisement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3- Hand delivery of the invitation to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4- Any other modern means of communication specified in the executive regulations of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, time, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend. The meeting of the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly for this purpose.

### Article (21)
The meeting of the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders with voting rights representing more than half of the subscribed shares. If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be called for a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of not less than seven days and not more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

### Article (22)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall submit to the Founding General Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information on all
