### Article (23)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1- Approving the company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and compliance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2- Approving the valuation of in-kind shares <orig>الحصص العينية</orig>, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3- Electing the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4- Appointing the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and determining their fees.
5- Appointing members of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company conducts its activities in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>).
6- Declaring the final incorporation of the company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting, including the resolutions adopted, shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall publish the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final declaration of the company's incorporation.

### Article (24)
**Rights and Obligations of Shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>**
A member of the company shall specifically enjoy the following rights:
1- Receiving profits and obtaining bonus shares <orig>أسهم المنحة</orig> that are decided for distribution.
2- Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and attending general assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig> and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3- Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements <orig>البيانات المالية</orig> for the expired accounting period, the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report, and the auditor's <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> report.
4- Disposing of his owned shares <orig>الأسهم المملوكة له</orig> and priority in subscribing to new shares <orig>الأسهم الجديدة</orig>.
5- Receiving a share of the company's assets <orig>موجودات الشركة</orig> upon liquidation after settling its debts.

### Article (25)
A member of the company shall specifically be obligated to the following:
1- Paying the installments due on his owned shares <orig>أسهم</orig> upon their due dates and compensating for delays in payment.
2- Paying the expenses incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments <orig>الأقساط غير المدفوعة</orig> of his share value. The company may execute on the shares to satisfy its rights.
3- Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4- Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests of the company and being obligated to compensate for damages arising from violating this.

### Article (26)
The General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> may not do the following:
1- Increasing the shareholder's financial burdens or increasing the nominal value of the share <orig>قيمة السهم الاسمية</orig>.
2- Decreasing the percentage of net profits <orig>الأرباح الصافية</orig> to be distributed to shareholders, as specified in the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
3- Imposing new conditions other than those mentioned in the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> regarding the shareholder's right to attend and vote in general assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig>.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders or by a collective vote involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.

### Article (27)
A - Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> consisting of (three) members, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is elected.

### Article (28)
Shareholders <orig>المساهمون</orig> shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot. The company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> may stipulate that a number not exceeding half of the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall be elected from among the company's founders <orig>مؤسسي الشركة</orig>.

### Article (29)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect by secret ballot a Chairman <orig>رئيساً للمجلس</orig> and a Vice-Chairman <orig>نائباً للرئيس</orig>. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company in its relations with third parties and before the judiciary, in addition to other competencies specified in the articles of association <orig>العقد</orig>. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's resolutions and adhere to its recommendations. The Vice-Chairman <orig>نائب الرئيس</orig> shall act in place of the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

### Article (30)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from outside, who shall be entrusted with the management of the company. The Board shall define his competencies and powers to sign on behalf of the company.

### Article (31)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.

### Article (32)
Every shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, whether a natural or legal person, may appoint representatives to the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to the shares they own in it. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of Board members to be elected. Shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> who have representatives on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate with other shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. A group of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and duties as the elected members.
The shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> shall be responsible for the actions of his representatives towards the company, its creditors, and its shareholders <orig>مساهميها</orig>.

### Article (33)
A meeting of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by at least half of the members, and the number of attendees shall not be less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication means, and resolutions may be adopted by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

### Article (34)
Minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary <orig>أمين سر المجلس</orig>. Any member who did not approve a resolution adopted by the Board may record his objection in the meeting minutes.

### Article (35)
If a position of a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder <orig>المساهمين</orig> who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If that person is prevented, the next in line shall succeed him. The new member shall complete only the term of his predecessor.
However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must

(This provision does not apply to companies authorized to lend.)

## Article (44)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and its members are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud, abuse of authority, any violation of the law or the company's articles of association, or for errors in management. A proposal by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to discharge the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from liability does not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions related to their discharge from liability for their management, or those concerning a special benefit for them, their spouses, or first-degree relatives, or a conflict existing between them and the company.

## Article (45)
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability attaching to a specific member, or joint liability among all members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable to pay compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that established the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.

## Article (46)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.

## Article (47)
Every shareholder may individually file a liability lawsuit on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be made a party to the lawsuit so that compensation may be awarded to it if warranted. A shareholder may file a personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

## Article (48)
### B – The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>
The annual ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the fiscal year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. The Board may invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet whenever necessary. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must issue an invitation for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to meet based on a reasoned request from shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon the request of the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party. The provisions related to the founding assembly stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for inviting the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, the quorum for attendance, and voting.

## Article (49)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of their representative in matters related to a special benefit for them, or a conflict existing between them and the company. Any condition or resolution that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may delegate another to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholders' register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>القاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to issue an order on a petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting rights for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the law
inviting the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of shareholders to meet within two months from the date of the last registered center, and to elect those who will fill the vacant positions.

## Article (36)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
- Must have legal capacity to act.
- Must not have been previously convicted of a felony involving deprivation of liberty, a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, a crime against honor or trust, or a penalty restricting liberty due to violation of legal provisions, unless their rehabilitation has been restored.
- Must personally own, or the person they represent must own, (1%) of the company's shares.
If a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease.

## Article (37)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be included within the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. A person may be the chairman of the board of directors of more than one closed joint-stock company.

## Article (38)
The chairman or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain benefit for themselves or others. A member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on share disposal stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association, or these regulations.

## Article (39)
Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not disclose to anyone other than the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings or to third parties any company secrets they became aware of due to their management, otherwise they shall be fined and held accountable for compensating damages resulting from the violation.

## Article (40)
The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any member of the Board may not combine membership in the board of directors of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or trade for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company may demand compensation from them for the operations they carried out, considering their account as if it were conducted for the company's account, unless this was done with the approval of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (41)
The total remuneration of the Chairman and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon). An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a resolution issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, an independent board member may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration (if the company has independent members). The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to the company's ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> for approval, which must accurately include a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages received by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, regardless of their nature or designation.

## Article (42)
No person with representation on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or the chairman, or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or a member of the executive management, or their spouses, or second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.
<page_end>136</page_end>

Civil and Commercial Pleadings.

If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to convene the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall call for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (50)
The meeting of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة</orig> shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, his deputy, or a person delegated by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for that purpose, or a person elected by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> from among the shareholders or others.

### Article (57)
The extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة غير العادية</orig> meeting shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>. If this quorum is not met, a second meeting shall be called, which shall be valid if attended by representatives of more than half of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>. Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>.

### Article (51)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة العادية</orig> shall, in its annual meetings, be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activity and financial position for the ended financial year.
2- The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3- A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4- The company's financial statements.
5- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6- Discharging the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7- Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and determining their remunerations.
8- Appointing the company's auditor <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig>, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9- Appointing the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company operates according to the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>) and hearing its report.
10- Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties <orig>الأطراف ذات الصلة</orig>, where related parties <orig>الأطراف ذات الصلة</orig> are defined according to International Accounting Standards <orig>مبادئ المحاسبة الدولية</orig>.

### Article (58)
Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent in the following matters:
1- Amending the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2- Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolving, merging, transforming, or splitting the company.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة</orig>.

### Article (52)
By a resolution issued by the company's ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than one-quarter of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>.
Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and the election of a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may decide either for the existing board to continue managing the company's affairs until the new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee <orig>لجنة إدارية مؤقتة</orig> whose primary task shall be to convene the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

### Article (59)
Any resolution issued by the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until the publication procedures <orig>إجراءات الشهر</orig> have been taken.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital <orig>رأسمالها</orig>.

### Article (53)
The ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda, unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by one of the regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة</orig>. If, during the discussion, the information related to some presented matters is found to be insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders representing one-quarter of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>, and the postponed meeting shall be convened without the need for new invitation procedures.

### Article (60)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullification of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or the ordinary or extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العادية أو غير العادية</orig> that violates the law, the company's articles of incorporation <orig>عقد تأسيس الشركة</orig>, or these regulations, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and may claim compensation when necessary.
Appeals may also be filed against resolutions of the ordinary and extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العادية وغير العادية</orig> that prejudice the rights of the minority. Such appeals shall be filed by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>, provided they have not approved those resolutions.

### Article (54)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these regulations.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must re-present the violating resolutions to the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting called for the purpose of discussing the aspects of the violation.

### Article (61)
Company Accounts
The company's financial year <orig>السنة المالية</orig> begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the first financial year <orig>السنة المالية الأولى</orig>, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on [missing date/month] of the following financial year.

### Article (55)
The provisions related to the ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall apply to the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة غير العادية</orig>, taking into account the provisions stipulated in the following articles:

### Article (62)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of no less than ten percent of the net profits <orig>الأرباح الصافية</orig> shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig>.
The statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover company losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital <orig>رأس المال المدفوع</orig> in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital <orig>رأس المال المصدر</orig>.
Also, one percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit <orig>الربح الصافي</orig>.

### Article (56)
The extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or upon a reasoned request from shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital <orig>رأسمال الشركة المصدر</orig> or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية العامة</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits <orig>الأرباح الصافية</orig> may be deducted to form an optional reserve <orig>احتياطي اختياري</orig> allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig>.

## Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig>

Announcement No. MOFA 2025/2-2026 regarding the qualification of companies to provide translation services in all specializations and languages

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> announces the opening of registration for companies to provide translation services in all specializations and languages. Companies wishing to register should refer to the Administrative and Financial Affairs – Procurement and Institute Control (Procurement Department) at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> to obtain registration forms and required conditions for a fee of K.D. 30 (thirty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only). This is during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 2025/06/22. Please note that the deadline for submitting applications is Sunday, 2025/07/03. The preliminary meeting with companies will be held on Sunday, 2025/6/29 at 11:00 AM.

Please attach the following:
- An authorization letter from the company to purchase the announcement in the name of the person.
- A copy of the civil ID of the authorized person.
- A copy of the commercial register.
- Payment of the prescribed fees for purchasing announcement documents via K-net.
- The company must specialize in this field.

For inquiries, please contact Mr. Mohammed Abathra'a <orig>محمد أباذراع</orig> – Ext: 7731
Tel: 22225555 – Ext: 1128

## Announcement
Auction License Project No. (M/1/2025-2026)
For the Exploitation and Investment of the Equestrian Building <orig>مبنى الفروسية</orig> belonging to the Police Sports Federation <orig>اتحاد الشرطة الرياضي</orig>
(Non-divisible)
The Investment Projects Department <orig>إدارة المشاريع الاستثمارية</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces the offering of Auction No. (M/1/2025-2026) concerning the investment of the Equestrian Building <orig>مبنى الفروسية</orig> belonging to the Police Sports Federation <orig>اتحاد الشرطة الرياضي</orig>, to be utilized as stipulated in the general and special conditions.
Companies and institutions specialized in this field with previous experience, wishing to participate in this auction, should refer to the Investment Projects Department <orig>إدارة المشاريع الاستثمارية</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building, Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig>, during official working hours, starting from Monday, 2025/6/23, to obtain the general and special conditions booklet for this auction, for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 100) for the auction.
The site inspection date for performing the service will be Monday, 2025/7/7. (Equestrian Club Building <orig>نادي الفروسية</orig> / Subhan <orig>صبحان</orig>). A preliminary meeting for those who have obtained the conditions booklet will be held at the Investment Projects Department <orig>إدارة المشاريع الاستثمارية</orig> headquarters at 10:00 AM on Monday, 2025/7/14. Bids are to be deposited with the Purchase Bid Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض مظاريف الشراء</orig> (Ground Floor) at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> (formerly Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig>). Please note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Thursday, 2025/7/31, from 8:00 AM to 1:00 PM, and no bids submitted before or after the mentioned time will be accepted.
For review and inquiries: Investment Projects Department <orig>إدارة المشاريع الاستثمارية</orig> – Tel: 22410802

# Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee in its Session
## No. 2025/15 Held

After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in birth and death records, the Committee decided to publish the following in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the Committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

# Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee in its Session
## Held on 2025/05/20

The Births and Deaths Committee, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met.

| Chairman | Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> |
|:---|:---|
| Member | Mr. / Director of the Central Registry Department for Births and Deaths <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> |
| Member | Ms. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> |
| Member | Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig> |
| Member | Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>قسم السجلات</orig> |
| Member | Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>قسم القيد</orig> |
| Member | Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> |

Ms. Shukriya Al-Duraie <orig>شكرية الدريعي</orig> acted as the Committee's secretary.

The Committee reviewed requests from number ((199)) to number ((204)) in the attached list, pertaining to amending data in birth and death records for dropped birth and death registrations. After its review and ensuring the completeness of documents and supporting papers, the Committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement expires and no objection is submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued.

### Announcement of a Criminal Judgment

The General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> issued, in its session held on 2024-11-12,
in Case No.: 000317 / 24 - General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>, Misdemeanors and Municipal Violations
Report No.: (0002330 / 23 - Municipality)
Automated Judicial Number: 243565590
against the accused: Mubarak Mohammed Saeed Al-Mahri <orig>مبارك محمد سعيد المهري</orig>
Nationality: Saudi Arabia Civil ID No.: 269032302523
an absentia judgment ruling: to punish the accused with a fine of one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> for what was attributed to him.
The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> hereby notifies the convicted person of this judgment and instructs all security authorities to enforce it in accordance with the text of Article 188 of the Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig>, noting that if a period of thirty-seven days, calculated from the second day of publication, elapses without the convicted person appealing by objection or appeal, the judgment becomes final and enforceable against him.
Director of the Criminal Enforcement Prosecution

# Announcement of Real Estate Sale by Public Auction
The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the sale of the following described property by public auction,
on Thursday, 17/07/2025 - Hall 5 - on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig>,
at 9:00 AM - in execution of the court judgment issued in
Lawsuit No. 2023/28 Sales/3
Filed by: Suha Jabr Ali Al-Jabr <orig>سهى جبر على الجبر</orig>.
Against:
1- Adela Jabr Ali Al-Jabr <orig>عادلة جبر على الجبر</orig>.
2- Karima Jabr Ali Al-Jabr <orig>كريمة جبر على الجبر</orig>.
3- Abeer Jabr Ali Al-Jabr <orig>عبير جبر على الجبر</orig>.
4- Nada Jabr Ali Al-Jabr <orig>ندا جبر على الجبر</orig>.
5- Nawaf Jabr Ali Al-Jabr <orig>نواف جبر على الجبر</orig>.
6- Fahad Jabr Ali Al-Jabr <orig>فهد جبر على الجبر</orig>.
7- Director of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> - in his capacity.
Firstly: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.

Property Document No. 1972/972 located in Funaitees Area <orig>منطقة الفنيطيس</orig>
Plot No. 9 - Parcel 1 - Plan M / 19846, with an area of 2481.2
m²
On 30/4/2019, we proceeded to inspect the property subject of the lawsuit, accompanied by Mr.
Expert / Salman Hamad Al-Bahwa <orig>سلمان حمد البحوه</orig> in his capacity as the second defendant personally. The plaintiff
and the remaining defendants failed to attend. The inspection at the time was as follows:
- The property subject of the lawsuit, located in Funaitees Area <orig>منطقة الفنيطيس</orig> - Plot 9 -
Street 46 - Parcel No. 22 - consists of a building comprising a ground floor + half
first floor + roof. The building is surrounded by a courtyard used for car parking, in addition
to a garden. All these buildings are enclosed by a fence with two gates, one overlooking
a main street and the other a side street. The disputed property is located on two streets,
front and back, bordered by a dirt lot from the east and a neighbor from the west, which is
a chain of restaurants. The total area of the disputed property is 2481 m².
- The buildings of the disputed property have stone facades + Sigma paint, are in old condition, and the doors
and windows are aluminum.
- The first building consists of a reception hall + dining room + kitchen + 4 bedrooms +
5 bathrooms. The floors are marble, walls are painted, ceilings have gypsum decor, lighting is
spotlights, and air conditioning is central.
- The second building is considered an annex, consisting of 4 bedrooms + 2 kitchens + 2 bathrooms, and its condition is
old.
The expert took all observations and reviewed the lawsuit file
and inspected the property subject of the lawsuit in preparation for its valuation.
Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence with a base price of 2,009,610 K.D. (Two Million, Nine Thousand,
Six Hundred and Ten Kuwaiti Dinars). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of this price
by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee
from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full
approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price,
otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which
the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward
in that session who accepts to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price.
In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to pay the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward
to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded
to them in the previous session. In this session, no bid not accompanied by a full deposit
of its value will be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership,
enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees,
and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement shall be published according to the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall request it, at their
own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> at the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> according to Article 266 of
the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is subject to appeal within seven days from the date of its pronouncement,
according to Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person
whose ownership has been divested is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated

First: Property Description: According to the attached description certificate.
Property document number 2008/2814 located in Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> – Plot No. 115 – Parcel 6 – Plan M / 20012 – described as an investment building with an area of 763 m2.
Note: There are violations. 1- Dividing the basement into offices and leasing them. 2- Creating 4 apartments in the mezzanine. 3- Incorporating apartments into the distributor on all floors. 4- Building a guard's room on the ground floor. 5- Enclosing the suspended area with glass and light materials. 6- Placing light material rooms on the ground floor.
*Inspection:
During the expert session dated 23/7/2024, we moved to the property subject of the lawsuit located in Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> area – Plot (11) – Qutaiba Bin Muslim Street <orig>شارع قتيبة بن مسلم</orig>) Parcel (11506) in the presence and guidance of the plaintiffs' agent and in the presence of the administration's knowledge expert, Mr. Salman Al-Bahwa <orig>سلمان البحوه</orig>. The first defendant failed to appear, and the inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The property subject of the lawsuit conforms to the general specifications of document number (2814) issued by the Real Estate Registration and Documentation Department <orig>إدارة التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, with an area of (763) square meters.
2- The property is an investment building overlooking a main street from the front, bordered by neighbors on other sides.
3- The property subject of the lawsuit consists of a ground floor, (9) floors with (4) apartments per floor, and a full basement with two apartments.
4- The property has (2) elevators and (2) staircases leading to the floors.
5- The plaintiffs' representative stated that the property is leased and generates monthly income.
6- The property has several unshaded parking spaces.
7- The cladding of the property subject of the lawsuit is limestone (National Industries <orig>صناعات الوطنية</orig>).
8- The property's air conditioning is central air conditioning.
The administration's knowledge expert took the necessary notes in preparation for estimating its monthly rental value.

### Second: Auction Terms:

First: The auction shall start at a base price of KWD 1,393,200 (One Million, Three Hundred Ninety-Three Thousand, Two Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain therein as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

## Property Description:
As stated in the Municipality's property description certificate.
- An undivided share of 50% in the property under document number 1998/4231, located in Al-Salam <orig>السلام</orig> area - Plot No. 61 - Block No. 2 - Plan M / 32905 - with a total area of 500m², to be sold by public auction at a base price of / 292,500 K.D. (Two Hundred Ninety-Two Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars) for the offered share of the property.
The description certificate states that the property is a private residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + second floor + roof + bathroom + preparatory kitchen.
- The roof consists of: a laundry room + bathroom. There are two entrances.
- Stairs: One internal staircase serving the first floor and the roof.
- Flooring: Sicilian marble and parquet on the first floor.
- Walls: Paint.
- Air conditioning: Central.
- Elevators: None.
- Exterior finishes: Pink Jordanian stone with the facade studded with brown ceramic.

**According to the expert's report**
The property subject to the dispute, as it exists, is located in Al-Salam <orig>السلام</orig> area, Block No. (2) - Street No. (214), House No. (30). The inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The property subject to the dispute conforms in terms of general and specific specifications to document number (4231) dated 1998/4/12, with an area of 500m² - automated number 15620421.
2- The property subject to the dispute is a private residence house overlooking one street, bordered by neighbors on three sides, with a section overlooking Bab Al-Radd <orig>باب الرد</orig> Street. The plaintiff's agent was unable to enable the expert to inspect the property from the inside, therefore, we deemed it appropriate to take the property's specifications and inspect it from the outside.
3- The property subject to the dispute consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, and second floor, and its condition is good.
4- The exterior cladding is white stone.
5- The expert could not ascertain the possessor or beneficiary of the property, or for what purpose it is being utilized.
6- Mr. Expert of Knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> inspected the property from the outside in preparation for estimating its value (land and buildings) and submitting the relevant report.

## Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer is approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the fees for transfer and registration of ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and direct bidders are requested to proceed with the sale procedures at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

## Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Deputy Chief Justice of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Resolution No. (10) of 2020
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Resolution No. (1) of 2019
Regarding the regulation of company registration procedures

The Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
Having reviewed Law No. (1) of 2010 regarding the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
And Law No. (1) of 2019 regarding Companies,
And Resolution No. (1) of 2019 regarding the regulation of company registration procedures,
And upon the approval of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> at its meeting No. (10) of 2020 dated 15/11/2020,
And as required by the interest of work,
Has resolved:

Article (1)
The text of Article (1) of Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, shall be replaced with the following text:
Article (1)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall undertake the registration of companies in accordance with the provisions of Law No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, and for that purpose, it shall have all powers stipulated for the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> in this regard.

<table>
| No. | Description                                     |
| :-- | :---------------------------------------------- |
| 1   | Company Registration Application                |
| 2   | Company Memorandum of Association               |
| 3   | Company Articles of Association                 |
| 4   | Capital Deposit Certificate                     |
| 5   | Copy of Civil ID for Founders                   |
| 6   | Copy of Passport for Non-Kuwaiti Founders       |
| 7   | Bank Certificate confirming Capital Deposit     |
| 8   | Any other documents requested by the Authority  |
</table>

Article (2)
The following Article (2) shall be added to Resolution No. (1) of 2019, referred to above, with the following text:
Article (2)
The General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> shall be committed to registering companies within a period not exceeding (3) working days from the date of completion of all required documents, after payment of the prescribed fees.

Article (3)
All competent authorities, each within its jurisdiction, shall implement this resolution, and it shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Chairman of the Board of Directors of the General Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
Sheikh Dr. / Mishaal Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah <orig>مشعل جابر الأحمد الصباح</orig>

2- Certified qualification certificate.
3- Copy of the civil ID card.
Fifth: Procedures and conditions for accrediting qualifications from outside the country:
1- University qualifications and two-year diplomas after general secondary education are equated by the Ministry of Higher Education <orig>وزارة التعليم العالي</orig>.
2- Secondary and intermediate qualifications are equated by the Ministry of Education <orig>وزارة التربية</orig>.
Sixth: Nomination criteria for government entities:
Nomination for government entities covered by the central employment system is carried out according to their requests, by the number for each position (males and females), and according to the following criteria:
(a) Priority in nomination shall be given to those registered in the central employment system who have not previously been nominated to any entity, as well as those rejected by an entity. Thereafter, those who rejected a nomination for the first time will be nominated, followed by those who rejected more than once.
(b) Specialists holding university qualifications, diplomas, or specialized courses issued by the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>, with a duration of not less than one year, who are registered in previous employment periods and then in the current period, will be nominated according to the applicable nomination criteria for males and females, as follows: -
(The candidate with the highest qualification grade is preferred – if two are equal, the one who obtained the qualification earlier is preferred – if two are equal, the older one is preferred – if two are equal, the married one is preferred over the single one)
(c) For the nomination of non-specialists (holders of secondary qualifications and below) who have not obtained any training course, it is required that they enroll in a qualifying course in agreement with the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>. After completing the qualifying course, those registered in previous employment periods and then in the current period will be nominated according to the following criteria:
1- For males, the oldest married person is preferred, then the divorced and widowed, then the single.
2- For females, the divorced and widowed are preferred, then the married and single – if two are equal, the one who obtained the qualification earlier is preferred.
(d) Excluded from item (c) above are those registered (holders of secondary qualifications and below) who have not obtained any training course but wish to work in certain positions for which there is no demand and which are designated for specific government entities.
President of the Civil Service Commission <orig>ديوان الخدمة المدنية</orig>

### Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
Announcement of Practice No. TM – 2029-2025/282
Renewal and Update of Palo Alto Firewall Licenses and Devices
Palo Alto Information Network
The Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> announces the offering of the aforementioned practice. Specialized companies in this field registered with the Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> should visit (Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> Headquarters – Sharq – Plot 1 – Street 201 – 21st Floor – Room No. 211) to obtain the practice documents for a non-refundable fee of (-/75 K.D.) (Seventy-Five Kuwaiti Dinars only), payable by certified check. The specifications booklet will be delivered to (Information Technology Department) (Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> Headquarters – Sharq – Plot 1 Street 201 – 26th Floor – Office No. 2611) during the official working hours of the Authority, starting from Sunday, 2025/06/22 AD. The last day for submitting bids is Sunday, 2025/07/13 AD. Sealed bids must be submitted on the specified date before 1:00 PM (Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> Headquarters – Sharq – Plot 1 Street 201 – 22nd Floor – Room No. 2217).
The practitioner must also attach the following documents with the bid:
1- Copy of the commercial register.
2- Copy of the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> certificate.
3- Copy of the company registration receipt with the Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>.
4- Copy of the national labor percentage fulfillment certificate, valid for one year.
5- Copy of the registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>.
6- Copy of the practice purchase receipt.
7- The bid must be accompanied by an initial guarantee for the practice, valued at (2%), in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in favor of the Public Authority for Investment <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>, unconditional, and valid for at least (90) days from the last date for receiving bids.
8- Attach a certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article (95) of the Social Security Law <orig>قانون التأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>.
9- Attach a valid "To Whom It May Concern" certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the private sector. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.
Acting Executive Director of the Operations Sector

<table>
| (k) Only one thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee valid for (90) days in favor of the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> from the closing date. |
|---|
| | Preliminary Meeting (Inquiry Session) | | 11:00 AM on Tuesday, 1/7/2025, at the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> |
</table>

*   Bids must be submitted from 9:00 AM until 2:00 PM on the closing date. Bids must be delivered in sealed envelopes with red wax and placed in the box designated for practices at the Authority's headquarters (second floor). No bids received after the specified closing time for the practice will be accepted.
*   Compliance with the instructions of Article Twenty-Six regarding the submission of bids (CD) on the Public Authority for Sport's <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> website (Pas.gov.kw/tenders) is mandatory.
*   Companies / practitioners wishing to submit inquiries or clarifications must do so at the time and place specified above in the table (Preliminary Meeting (Inquiry Session)). No inquiries will be considered after the deadline.
*   All documents must be submitted on a (CD) and a non-reproducible hard copy, except for the bid form and initial insurance, which must be submitted as a hard copy.
*   Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of bid opening. Any bid not accompanied by the original or a copy of the receipt for purchasing the practice documents, the initial guarantee, and the national labor support certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> for the year 2025 will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, stating that there is no suspension on the practitioner's file regarding government contracts registered with the Authority or any of the violations mentioned in Article (10) of Law No. 8 of 2010 concerning work in the private sector. Please note that any bid not including this certificate will be excluded.
*   The bidder must attach a valid 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>, confirming clearance from consumption debts.
*   The practice is open to all companies and establishments specialized in the required works and registered with the Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2025, for a fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable via K-Net (non-refundable except in cases stipulated by Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> circulars), accompanied by the following:
    1.  A copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette.
    2.  A copy of the company's registration with the Authority for the year 2025.
    3.  A written letter of authorized delegation to the Authority, accompanied by (a copy of the civil ID and a copy of the signature authorization).
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) are exempted from the prescribed fees for purchasing practice documents, in accordance with the text of Article (39) of Law No. 74/2019 regarding amendments to Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016).
*   Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) wishing to apply for the practice must attach a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for SME Care and Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, confirming their accreditation as a small or medium enterprise. This is in accordance with the text of Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. (49/2016), which states: "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session in the presence of bidders or their representatives."
*   This announcement serves as an invitation for interested practitioners to attend, as companies wishing to attend the bid opening session have the right to coordinate with the competent committee before the session date.
*   This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
*   **Note**: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the practitioners.
*   For more information, please visit the Public Authority for Sport's <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> website (Pas.gov.kw).

<footer>
Acting Deputy Director General for Finance and Administrative Affairs Sector

Announcement
The Public Authority for Sport <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. PASD 22/2025/2026
regarding the supply, installation, and maintenance of a smart surveillance system at the Sports Demand Center <orig>مركز الطلب الرياضي</orig>, in sealed envelopes, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the practice documents. These documents can be obtained from the Services and Supplies Department - Tenders and Practices Section, Ground Floor, Office No. (5) at the Authority's headquarters in Al-Riqqa <orig>الرقعي</orig> area during official working hours or through the Public Authority for Sport's <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> website.

Based on the letter from the Ministry of Information / Wizarat Al-I'lam <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> No. (3250/11) dated 14/05/2024, received under General Register No. (2573) on the same date, and stating that, out of the Ministry of Information's / Wizarat Al-I'lam's <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> keenness to expedite customs clearance procedures and facilitate transactions for their owners, and based on the statement of the specialized sector within the Ministry, the Ministry of Information / Wizarat Al-I'lam <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> has no objection to lifting the restriction from the automated customs system for materials subject to the Ministry's control, provided that these materials are of a personal nature, are not in commercial quantities, are not in the name of any frequent visitors to the customs department, and are not for the account of a commercial company, regardless of its legal form.

And based on the Unified Customs Law of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) States <orig>قانون الجمارك الموحد لدول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig> No. (10) of 2003, Article (24) thereof, regarding prohibitions and restrictions, whereas, as a general rule, restricted goods shall not be released except with the approval issued by the competent authorities in the State.

And based on Customs Instructions No. (139 - 140) of 2013, issued regarding the establishment of a unified mechanism for preparing immediate clearance declarations according to the automated system, specifically for traveler provisions, and by virtue of bills of lading and consignments from express courier companies, both commercial and non-commercial, which specified the value of non-commercial goods for which an immediate clearance declaration is made, such that their value does not exceed five thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

And based on Customs Instructions No. (94) of 2020, regarding setting the minimum value of goods below which customs duty is not collected, which it set at one hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Without prejudice to any other laws or decisions issued by the competent authorities in the State regarding restricted import goods.

Directors are kindly requested to take note and instruct their specialists not to refer immediate clearance shipments of a personal nature, classified as non-commercial, to the Ministry of Information / Wizarat Al-I'lam <orig>وزارة الإعلام</orig> in accordance with the controls stipulated in the Ministry's letter referred to above. For your information and action accordingly,

Director General of the General Administration of Customs / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Jumruk <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>
Issued on: 11/06/2025

# General Directorate of Civil Aviation / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Tayaran Al-Madani <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>
## Announcement of Tender No. (8-2022/2023)
Supply, Installation, Maintenance, Management, and Training of a Passenger Registration and Early Border Security Inquiry System at Kuwait International Airport

The General Directorate of Civil Aviation / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Tayaran Al-Madani <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Tender No. (8-2022/2023) for the Supply, Installation, Maintenance, Management, and Training of a Passenger Registration and Early Border Security Inquiry System at Kuwait International Airport.
Please note that the final deadline for submitting bids will be at 1:00 PM on Thursday, 28/08/2025, instead of Monday, 30/06/2025. Any bid submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

# Announcement 2025/65

Report on the work of the Committee for Studying Classification Requests of Local Kuwaiti Companies and Establishments and GCC Companies and Establishments Specialized in City Cleaning Works, as well as those working in General Cleaning, Waste Collection, and Transportation, submitted for classification to Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.

1- On 2025/04/13, Administrative Decision No. 2025/11 B (attached) was issued, forming a committee to study the classification requests of local Kuwaiti companies and establishments and GCC companies and establishments specialized in city cleaning works, as well as those working in general cleaning, waste collection, and transportation, submitted for classification to Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.

2- On 2025/05/04, Administrative Decision No. 2025/41 B (attached) was issued, amending Article One of Administrative Decision No. 2025/11 B issued on 2025/04/13.

3- In implementation of these decisions, the committee held its first meeting on 2025/04/02, chaired by Mr. Meshal Fahad Al-Joudan Al-Azmi <orig>مشعل فهد الجودان العازمي</orig> – Deputy Director General for Municipal Services Affairs – Chairman of the Committee for Studying Classification Requests.

4- During this meeting, the committee's assigned mission, as per the aforementioned decisions, was discussed.
Based on this, a framework for the committee's work was established in accordance with its competencies, defined as follows:
- Sorting classification requests submitted by companies and establishments to match them with the list sent by the Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء</orig>.
- Preparing a special form for extracting data submitted by companies for classification for each company or establishment individually.
- Distributing committee tasks according to its competencies as stated in its formation decisions.
- Studying the documents of classification requests submitted on the compact disc (CD) for each company or establishment individually to

requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in consideration of its classification.
Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation may issue its decision to that effect after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1- The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2- The lapse of (15) fifteen days from the date of publication of this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The cancellation of the license or registration shall result in the refund of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracting agreements concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial reservations for their interests due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Section <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

# Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>
## Announcement

The Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig> announces the submission of a request by:

<table_caption>Details of Companies Involved in Economic Concentration Request</table_caption>
<table>
| Company / Entity | Activity |
|:---|:-------|
| Saudi Fransi Capital Company <orig>شركة السعودي الفرنسي كابيتال</orig> (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia) <br> <image_caption>BSF Capital Logo</image_caption><image>{"description": "Logo of BSF Capital, a financial services company.", "type": "logo", "data": "BSF Capital"}</image> | Dealing, safekeeping, arranging, providing advice on securities, and managing investments in accordance with the Capital Market Authority's license. |
| Myfatoorah Electronic Payment Services Company <orig>شركة ماي فاتورة لتقديم خدمات الدفع الإلكتروني</orig> (Kuwait) <br> <image_caption>Myfatoorah Logo</image_caption><image>{"description": "Logo of Myfatoorah, an electronic payment services company.", "type": "logo", "data": "myatoorah"}</image> | Providing electronic payment services. |
</table>

a request for approval to complete an economic concentration process through the acquisition by Saudi Fransi Capital Company <orig>شركة السعودي الفرنسي كابيتال</orig> (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia) of 19.35% of the capital of Myfatoorah Electronic Payment Services Company <orig>شركة ماي فاتورة لتقديم خدمات الدفع الإلكتروني</orig> (Kuwait), in accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 regarding Competition Protection <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig> and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Resolution No. (14) of 2021 and its amendments, which stipulate that "any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within a period not exceeding (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication..." Accordingly, the Agency invites all interested parties to submit their reasoned objection to the aforementioned economic concentration process within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.

Objection data shall be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, Al Hamra Tower, 14th Floor, by filling out the form available on the website, along with paying the prescribed fee.

copy of the announcement).
The bidder must pay an amount of 100 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> in cash or by K-Net, as a (refundable deposit) <orig>تأمين مسترد</orig>,
to the cashier at the Financial Department of Kuwait Aviation Services Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية لخدمات الطيران</orig>.
A preliminary meeting will be held on Monday, 30/06/2025, at 11:00 AM
at the company's headquarters in Dajeej <orig>الضجيج</orig>.
Property owners can submit price offers accompanied by the payment receipt for the refundable deposit,
along with a copy of this announcement, at the company's headquarters located in Dajeej Area <orig>منطقة الضجيج</orig> – opposite
the Kuwait Airways Company <orig>شركة الخطوط الجوية الكويتية</orig> building – Procurement and Stores Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> during official working hours.
The deadline for submitting price offers is Monday, 07/07/2025, at 12:00 PM.

## Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig>
Announcement Regarding the List of Companies Invited to Participate in
Limited Tender No. (CB/CPC/2274/CNSL)
The Higher Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء العليا</orig> for tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries, upon the request of Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig>, announces the list of companies invited to participate in
Limited Tender No. (CB/CPC/2274/CNSL) Consultancy
Services for Feasibility Study and FEED for New
Operations Building inside MAB Refinery

In this regard, we draw attention to the fact that, based on the text of Article (16)
of Law No. (49) of 2016 regarding Public Tenders <orig>المناقصات العامة</orig>, the aforementioned tender may be
offered to the following list of (28) companies at least (30) days after the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette
(Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>).
A fee of (250 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>) must be paid for registration requests to add
the company's name to the limited tender lists. The deposit receipt must be attached
to the account of Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig>
(KW40NBOK0000000000002036478748)
for the application submitted for this purpose to the Secretariat of the Higher Purchasing Committee <orig>أمانة سر لجنة الشراء العليا</orig>.
No single person or group of persons combined may register
under more than one name during classification, or submit more than
one bid in a tender, except for alternative bids where the tender conditions
permit their submission.
However, a person who has a share in separate companies, each independent
with its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees,
and general administrative apparatus, may, during classification, register himself and
register each of his independent companies.
Any bid from a tenderer that violates this article shall be deemed null and void by judgment,
in accordance with Article No. (29) of Law No. (49) of 2016 regarding Public Tenders <orig>المناقصات العامة</orig>.
Any interested party or party seeking to be added to the list of companies invited
for the limited tender has the right to object to their exclusion or to submit an application to participate in the tender,
supported by relevant documents and addressed to Mr. / Chairman of the Higher Purchasing Committee <orig>رئيس لجنة الشراء العليا</orig>
for tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries, within (30) days from
the date of this announcement.

Further to the announcement published in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) Issue (1739), pages (158-159) dated 18/5/2025 regarding the aforementioned tender.

This announcement serves as a notification to all companies that purchased the tender documents to contact Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig> to reclaim the tender document purchase fees and initial security, and to provide us with their bank details via an official letter from the bank and by filling out the designated form for this purpose, so that we can refund the purchase fees.

Announcement
Pre-qualification for Limited Tenders on the List of Companies
The Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its Affiliates announces, upon the request of Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>, the tender
RFP- 2141607
SAND CONTROL AND ASSOCIATED SERVICES
FOR NORTH KUWAIT AREA

In this regard, we draw attention to the fact that, based on the text of Article (16) of Tenders Law No. (49) of 2016 <orig>قانون المناقصات رقم (49) لسنة 2016</orig> concerning Public Tenders, the aforementioned tender will be offered to the following list of (27) companies at least (30) days from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) and on the company's website. Any interested party whose name is not included in the list of invited companies for the tender has the right to appeal their exclusion or submit a request to participate in the tender, supported by relevant documents and addressed to Mr. / Chairman of the Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its Affiliates, within (30) days from the date of this announcement:

*   We would also like to draw the attention of bidders/companies that, based on the text of Article (29) of Law No. 49 of 2016 concerning Public Tenders <orig>قانون رقم 49 لسنة 2016 بشأن المناقصات العامة</orig>, "no single person" or group of natural persons may register under more than one name during classification or submit more than one bid in a tender, except for alternative bids where the tender conditions permit their submission. However, a person who has a share in separate companies, each independent with its legal personality, finances, engineers, employees, and administrative apparatus, shall have their bid considered null and void if it violates this article.
*   To learn about the qualification criteria or for any additional information, please visit the Unified Commercial Electronic Platform (K-Tendering Portal) on the website of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its subsidiaries:

    using the Filter.

Announcement
Annual Plan for Supply and Services Contracts
Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig> announces that, in accordance with Article No. (33) and Article No. (88) of Public Tenders Law No. 49/2016 <orig>قانون المناقصات العامة رقم 2016/49</orig> regarding the subject of the aforementioned announcement, the plan is published weekly on the official website of Kuwait Oil Company <orig>شركة نفط الكويت</orig>. Therefore, all those wishing to view it should visit the website continuously to get the latest updates by following these steps:
1- Company Website WWW.KOC.COM.KW
2- Click on E-business
3- Select one of the options: Tenders RFQ's and Purchases RFP's
4- Click on Upcoming
